results.deck: Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 is the third installment in the Smackdown Vs. Raw series.
results.name: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2007

results.deck: Like Mario Party...with teenage billionaire hotness!
results.name: Mary-Kate and Ashley: Sweet 16: Licensed to Drive

results.deck: Known as the granddaddy of the "Quick Time Event", Dragon's Lair is an interactive cartoon that lets players help guide the actions of brave knight Dirk the Daring, as he ventures through the dangerous castle of Singe the Dragon in order to rescue his beloved princess Daphne.
results.name: Dragon's Lair

results.deck: Ascend from a billionaire playboy to a feared superhero in the third-person adventure game tie-in to the 2005 feature film of the same name. It is the only game to be based on The Dark Knight Trilogy.
results.name: Batman Begins

results.deck: The famous soccer game comes back this year with updated teams and players. The control mechanics were modified, featuring heavy use of the skill stick, and upping the tempo of the entire game.
results.name: FIFA Soccer 07

results.deck: The second game in the Virtua Fighter series from Sega's AM2, adding two new fighters to the roster as well as impressive graphics for the time.
results.name: Virtua Fighter 2

results.deck: Sequel to RC car-themed kart racer RC Revenge.
results.name: RC Revenge Pro

results.deck: The eighth installment of the historical turn-based strategy game from Koei based off the novel "Three Kingdoms" by Luo Guanzhong.
results.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms VIII

results.deck: New Job classes, battle types, missions, quests, and more "player friendly" options highlight the third expansion for Final Fantasy XI.
results.name: Final Fantasy XI Online: Treasures of Aht Urhgan

results.deck: NBA Street V3 is the third entry in the popular NBA Street Series. Following in the footsteps of past games in the series, the game allows you to perform over the top dunks and tricks with your favorite NBA players.
results.name: NBA Street V3

results.deck: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 07 is an iteration in the popular EA sports golf series. Starring Tiger himself, the game includes improved visuals over previous games and a large cast of superstar golfers such as Phil Mickelson and Vijay Singh.
results.name: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 07

results.deck: Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex brings the fight to the sixth generation consoles while retaining a lot of the original concepts and ideas of the previously Playstation-focused franchise.
results.name: Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex

results.deck: Top-down shooter featuring a variety of witches and wizards aboard flying brooms, firing spells at incoming enemies. Features co-operative play and sold at a budget price in most areas.
results.name: Castle Shikigami 2

results.deck: The fourth installment in the SingStar franchise and the first era-specific release, SingStar '80s compiles chart-topping songs from throughout the decade.
results.name: SingStar '80s

results.deck: A game based on the cartoon Samurai Jack.
results.name: Samurai Jack: The Shadow of Aku

results.deck: A console-exclusive installment in the Serious Sam series.
results.name: Serious Sam: Next Encounter

results.deck: This sequel to the Dreamcast cult classic delivers 60s sci-fi style in spades. Funky space reporter Ulala delivers her trademark dance grooves while saving the galaxy from the dastardly Rhythm Rogues!
results.name: Space Channel 5: Part 2

results.deck: Shining Tears was co-developed by Amusement Vision and Nextech, published by SEGA for the PlayStation 2 in 2004, and is part of the Shining Force series. It tells the story of Xion, a mysterious boy. An anime adaptation, named Shining Tears X Wind, was adapated by Studio Deen in early 2007.
results.name: Shining Tears

results.deck: 187 Ride Or Die is a racing game for the Xbox and Playstation 2 that was published and developed by Ubisoft. It was released in North America on the 23rd of August 2005. The game was released three days after that in Europe.
results.name: 187: Ride or Die

results.deck: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger 2: Bush Rescue expands on the game play of the first game, but features new elements, such as driving sequences, mech battles, and an expanded world. In Ty 2, Ty must fight Boss Cass once again to save the Australian outback.
results.name: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger 2: Bush Rescue

results.deck: Ghosthunter is a horror themed third person shooter which has you cast as newly appointed ghost hunter Lazarus Jones. Having unwittingly released hundreds of ghosts from a special vault, Lazarus must explore a myriad of haunted locales to fix his mistake and save his abducted partner.
results.name: Ghosthunter

results.deck: Manic 3D action-adventure game based on the Cartoon Network animated series of the same name.
results.name: Ed, Edd n Eddy: The Mis-Edventures

results.deck: A 3D spinoff of the King of Fighters series.
results.name: The King of Fighters: Maximum Impact

results.deck: This platform adventure game sees players assuming the role of Jimmy Neutron, who returns to Earth from space with a dangerous alien stowaway.
results.name: The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius - Attack of the Twonkies

results.deck: A street racing game featuring 11 tracks across the United States of America.
results.name: USA Racer

results.deck: The fourth game in the Donpachi series and the first to be ported to the PS2, courtesy of Arika.
results.name: Dodonpachi Dai-Ou-Jou

results.deck: Take the role of Wolverine, Iceman and Nightcrawler and use their superpowers through a series of missions.
results.name: X-Men: The Official Game

results.deck: Super Thunder Blade is a shooter casting the player as a helicopter pilot tasked with, almost, single-handedly defeating an enemy army. Super Thunder Blade was one of the two original Japanese launch titles for the Mega Drive. The other was Space Harrier II.
results.name: Super Thunder Blade

results.deck: Sport Simulation game based of Judo.  David Douillet was a popular Judoka from France who has won gold medals in the Olympics. That is why the game was named after him.
results.name: David Douillet Judo

results.deck: Play as a large variety of Star Wars characters from the prequel trilogy in this LEGO-meets-Star Wars action game.
results.name: LEGO Star Wars: The Video Game

results.deck: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Zero is a street racing game based on the highways of Japan's capital city.
results.name: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Zero

results.deck: The fourth game in the Grandia series, Grandia III concerns a young man who wants to fly more than anything else in the world.
results.name: Grandia III

results.deck: Gaelic Games: Football 2 is the second game in the Gaelic Games franchise. It was launched on November 7th 2007. It was launched beside Gaelic Games: Hurling
results.name: Gaelic Games: Football 2

results.deck: NASCAR 2005 revolutionizes NASCAR video games by adding the National, Craftsman Truck, and Featherlite Modified Series to the game, plus the all new Chase points format in an all new Chase for the Cup Mode.
results.name: NASCAR 2005: Chase for the Cup

results.deck: F355 Challenge is a realistic racing sim developed by SEGA-AM2. It originally appeared in arcades in 1999, and soon after was ported to the Dreamcast and later to the PS2.
results.name: F355 Challenge: Passione Rossa

results.deck: Burnout 3: Takedown was first in the series to feature the signature takedown system for combating opponents. Revolutionizing the series, it has been the gameplay model for Burnout games ever since.
results.name: Burnout 3: Takedown

results.deck: The spiritual successor of Bomberman Generation, Bomberman Jetters is loosely based on the anime of the same name.
results.name: Bomberman Jetters

results.deck: Now is your chance to set off fireworks without blowing off one of your limbs!
results.name: FantaVision

results.deck: Mortal Kombat: Deception is the sixth installment in the violent fighting game franchise, introducing a manual "Combo Breaker" system and online multiplayer while adding a more in-depth Konquest Mode.
results.name: Mortal Kombat: Deception

results.deck: A side-scrolling platform game released in 1991. It is the sequel to the original James Pond, and now parodies RoboCop as well as James Bond.
results.name: James Pond 2: Codename: RoboCod

results.deck: The third game in the top down scrolling arcade type shooter series.
results.name: Raiden III

results.deck: A sequel to NBA Showtime: NBA on NBC that introduced a 3-on-3 format to the ubiquitous NBA Jam formula of Midway basketball games.
results.name: NBA Hoopz

results.deck: The King of Fighters 2001 is the eighth installment of the King of Fighters series, radically switching the traditional 3-on-3 team system with a dynamic team system.
results.name: The King of Fighters 2001

results.deck: A demon overlord who's soul is bound to a book tries to restore his lost powers in this comedy JRPG.
results.name: Makai Kingdom: Chronicles of the Sacred Tome

results.deck: Summer Heat Beach Volleyball is a PlayStation 2 exclusive volleyball game.
results.name: Summer Heat Beach Volleyball

results.deck: Another set of classic Capcom games for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox.
results.name: Capcom Classics Collection: Volume 2

results.deck: Delta Force: Black Hawk Down is a first-person shoooter developed and published by Novalogic, based on the same events portrayed in the novel and film "Black Hawk Down".
results.name: Delta Force: Black Hawk Down

results.deck: The semi-sequel to the 1982 sci-fi horror film.
results.name: The Thing

results.deck: Worms 3D is the first game in the popular Worms series developed by Team17 to feature fully 3-dimensional graphics.
results.name: Worms 3D

results.deck: A third-person hack and slash game featuring Conan the Barbarian only released in Europe.
results.name: Conan

results.deck: A crossover fighting game in the vein of Smash Bros., Dream Mix TV World Fighters brings together characters from a diverse assortment of Konami, Hudson, and Takara franchises.
results.name: Dream Mix TV World Fighters

results.deck: When the plan for humans to colonize the Moon goes awry, it's up to Maverick Hunters X, Zero, and Axl to hunt down Mavericks in the eighth (and last) official installment of the Mega Man X series (bringing the gameplay more in-line with the series's roots).
results.name: Mega Man X8

results.deck: Fur Fighters is a third-person shooter video game developed by Bizarre Creations for the SEGA Dreamcast, PlayStation 2 and PC platforms featuring six cuddly animals as the protagonists
results.name: Fur Fighters

results.deck: The inaugural multi-player installment to the horror franchise, Resident Evil: Outbreak challenged gamers to team up with three others online in an attempt to escape the T-Virus and Raccoon City.
results.name: Resident Evil: Outbreak

results.deck: Take control of the world's most famous wizard as he enters the school of Hogwarts.
results.name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone

results.deck: King Neptune's crown has been stolen, and all evidence points to Mr. Krabs. Join Spongebob and Patrick on their journey to retrieve the crown and save their beloved friend from execution.
results.name: SpongeBob SquarePants: The Movie

results.deck: In Colosseum, you fight to work your way up to freedom in Rome's famous gladiatorial battles.
results.name: Colosseum: Road to Freedom

results.deck: Magna Carta: Tears of blood is a Japanese RPG that was released for Sony's Playstation 2.
results.name: Magna Carta: Tears of Blood

results.deck: A sim-like racer released by Namco in 2003 for the Xbox, Playstation 2, and Gamecube.
results.name: R:Racing Evolution

results.deck: Twenty international teams, 600 players, and tournaments like VI Nation and Tri-nations are included in this sports sim.
results.name: Rugby

results.deck: A stealth action game made by Acquire
results.name: Shinobido: Way of the Ninja

results.deck: Help to repair the damage done to the world and repel an evil pirate invasion in this critically acclaimed platforming adventure.
results.name: Rayman 2: The Great Escape

results.deck: Silent Hill 2: Restless Dreams is an updated version of the original Silent Hill 2 released a month after the original version.
results.name: Silent Hill 2: Restless Dreams

results.deck: The Typing of the Dead is an educational game that focuses on enhancing one's typing skills through the slaughter of the undead.
results.name: The Typing of the Dead

results.deck: NeoGeo Battle Coliseum is a 2-on-2 tag-team crossover fighting game from SNK Playmore that features characters from many different SNK franchises, like King of Fighters and Metal Slug.
results.name: NeoGeo Battle Coliseum

results.deck: A spin-off of the Army Men franchise starring Vikki Grimm.
results.name: Portal Runner

results.deck: A compilation for the PlayStation 2, containing both Gradius III and Gradius IV.
results.name: Gradius III and IV

results.deck: A boxing game based on the Rocky movies.  You play as Rocky and try to win the World Championship.  You'll fight against characters from the series as well as a few new ones.  You get to fight Apollo Creed and Clubber Lang.
results.name: Rocky

results.deck: A spin-off of the Jak and Daxter franchise that sees our heroes, fresh from saving the world in Jak 3, forced to participate in brutal races for their very lives.
results.name: Jak X: Combat Racing

results.deck: The first installment in a trio of Spin-offs of the Dragonball Z Budokai series. This game was developed by Spike rather than Dimps who did the original Budokai series.
results.name: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi

results.deck: Black Market Bowling is a European only bowling game for the Playstation 2.
results.name: Black Market Bowling

results.deck: Shrek 2 is a video game based off the film of the same name. Players compete with four characters throughout eleven levels.
results.name: Shrek 2

results.deck: Seek and Destroy is a vehicular combat game in which the world of "Quewar" is populated, not by people, but by tanks. The story follows the "Q-Stein" invasion of "Proton" and the Proton military's struggle to repel the attack.
results.name: Seek and Destroy

results.deck: NBA 2K2 brings the NBA 2K series of realistic basketball games to all sixth-generation consoles, updating the roster to the 2001/2002 NBA season while adding a new "Fantasy Mode", where every player in the season is put into the drafting pool.
results.name: NBA 2K2

results.deck: The Incredibles stars a family of people with superpowers who try to conceal them from the outside world for fear of prejudice. Bob Parr has superhuman strength, Dash has super speed, Violet can turn invisible and project force fields and Elastigirl can stretch.
results.name: The Incredibles

results.deck: Fourth in the Series, First venture onto the Playstation 2, and a welcome addition to the Tactics RPG franchise.
results.name: Front Mission 4

results.deck: The third instalment in the Pro Evolution Soccer franchise makes a number of improvements on the classic footballing formula.
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 3

results.deck: The Fast and the Furious comes to consoles to give users the experience of "Tokyo Drift," which is based off the popular movie of the same name.
results.name: The Fast and the Furious

results.deck: The third revision of Guilty Gear X2 adds new gameplay mechanics and special moves while re-designing the game's aesthetics.
results.name: Guilty Gear XX Λ Core

results.deck: The final chapter in the Legacy of Kain series, this game follows the adventures of Kain and Raziel in their struggles to save Nosgoth from an ancient enemy.
results.name: Legacy of Kain: Defiance

results.deck: A skiing game for both the Playstation 2 and Game Boy Advance.
results.name: Jonny Moseley Mad Trix

results.deck: This is the 3D version of Metal Slug, confusingly called Metal Slug.
results.name: Metal Slug

results.deck: Based on the 2005 Movie with Johnny Depp.  This game follows Charlie around Wonka's factory, helping solve puzzles, save the other children and work with Oompa-loompa's.
results.name: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory

results.deck: Flatout 2 is a racing game that brings racing and massive destruction to it's players and to the environment as well.
results.name: FlatOut 2

results.deck: The third game in Capcom's popular action adventure series. This is a prequel to the original Devil May Cry and the first game of the franchise's storyline chronologically. The game saw a re-release in Devil May Cry 3: Special Edition, which added a new character, among other things.
results.name: Devil May Cry 3: Dante's Awakening

results.deck: The third game in Koei's Kessen series depicts a fictionalized and romanticized version of the life of Nobunaga Oda.
results.name: Kessen III

results.deck: This game picks up two years after the events of the original Hunter: The Reckoning and brings similar gameplay, and two new characters, to the cursed town of Ashcroft.
results.name: Hunter: The Reckoning - Wayward

results.deck: The Final Fight franchise makes a gritty return as a 3D open-world beat 'em up for sixth-generation consoles.
results.name: Final Fight: Streetwise

results.deck: Play as Mulder and Scully in Resist or Serve, an action game from 2004 featuring an original story, several voices from the show, and a whole lotta kickin'.
results.name: The X-Files: Resist or Serve

results.deck: Transformers Tatakai is an action game based on the popular cartoon Transformers released in Japan.
results.name: Transformers Tatakai

results.deck: Garfield is a PC (and PS2 in Europe only) Adventure game by The Code Monkeys, based on the syndicated comic strip of the same name.
results.name: Garfield

results.deck: Three adventurers that have met by chance find the Demon Stone, an ancient prison, just as it breaks before their eyes. The contained evil is unleashed and the wicked spirits of a Githyanki general and a Slaad lord once again threaten the world.
results.name: Forgotten Realms: Demon Stone

results.deck: Okage: Shadow King - known as Boku to Maou (Me and Satan King) in Japan - is a quirky horror-themed JRPG that takes inspiration from Tim Burton.
results.name: Okage: Shadow King

results.deck: An offroad racing game.
results.name: Dakar 2: The World's Ultimate Rally

results.deck: A shooting game developed by Hudson.
results.name: Star Soldier
